result.execSummary:
The defendant Marqwell D Good was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO COUNTS ONE AND THREE:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three.  Credit for 258 days.

Defendant's pro se motion to vacate DNA surcharge.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (28 pages) commencing DECEMBER 2, 2014 received and filed. kl
to Judge Donald; from defendant's mother Tunisha B. - filed.
Associated with Charge #3
Defendant's RISK Assessment filed by ADA Joy Hammond on behalf of the State.

Defendant Marqwell D Good in court with attorney Robert L. Taylor.  Defendant Marqwell D Good in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Changes made to the PSI as set forth on the record.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by Officer Eric Draeger.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 9 YEARS, concurrent to Count 3.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit for 258 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS, concurrent to Count 1.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with the co-actors.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  Court "administratively" ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Court "administratively" ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $243.00 payable to the victim, Gary W.  Court "administratively" ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for sentencing purposes.

Defendant Marqwell D Good in court with attorney Robert L. Taylor.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #s 2, 4, 5, and 6 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Defense requests a PSI.
Court GRANTS request.
**Court ordered a PSI with a recommendation.

Case adjourned to 12-02-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.
